name: Agentic AI
notes: Autonomous AI systems capable of complex decision-making and action planning.

name: Generative AI & Multimodal Models
notes: AI capable of creating text, images, code, and 3D models from various inputs.

name: AI-Augmented Software Engineering
notes: AI copilots and autonomous agents automating code generation, testing, and deployment.

name: AI Safety & Governance Platforms
notes: Tools to monitor, secure, and ensure ethical, reliable, and compliant operation of AI systems.

name: Multi-Agent Systems
notes: The coordination of multiple specialized agents to achieve complex goals beyond any single agent's capability.

name: Humanoid Robots
notes: General-purpose robots with human-like physical forms for tasks in complex, human-designed environments.

name: Swarm Robotics
notes: Large groups of simple, coordinated robots for parallel tasks like large-area inspection or construction.

name: Edge AI & Federated Learning
notes: Processing data locally (Edge AI) and collaborative model training on distributed data (Federated Learning).

name: Quantum Computing
notes: Utilizing quantum mechanics to solve problems intractable for classical computers (e.g., optimization, simulation).

name: Post-Quantum Cryptography
notes: New cryptographic algorithms designed to resist attacks from future quantum computers.

name: Structural Battery Composites
notes: Materials that simultaneously store energy and bear mechanical load, reducing weight/space.

name: Green Nitrogen Fixation
notes: Developing highly energy-efficient and low-carbon methods for producing ammonia (fertilizer).

name: Next-Gen Nuclear (SMRs)
notes: Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) offering scalable, safer, and faster-to-deploy low-carbon energy.

name: Carbon Capture & Utilization
notes: Technologies that capture CO2 from industrial sources or the air and convert it into useful products or materials.

name: Engineered Living Therapeutics
notes: Cells or organisms modified to sense and respond to disease in the body.

name: RNA & Epigenetic Therapies
notes: Treatments that control gene expression without altering the underlying DNA sequence.

name: Bio-Digital Interfaces
notes: Technologies like Neuralink that directly connect biological systems to digital networks.

name: Synthetic Biology Platforms
notes: Tools and systems to engineer biological components and systems for new functions (e.g., materials, computation).

name: 6G Networks
notes: Next-gen wireless offering terahertz speeds, AI integration, and extreme low latency/massive density.

name: Satellite Internet Constellations
notes: Massive LEO/MEO satellite networks (Starlink, OneWeb) providing global, low-latency, high-speed internet access.

name: Collaborative Sensing Networks
notes: A network where individual sensors (cameras, environmental, LiDAR) share and fuse data to create a single, real-time picture of the environment.

name: Digital Twin of the Customer
notes: A dynamic, virtual model of an individual citizen or demographic, used for personalized services and planning.

name: Superapps
notes: All-in-one digital platforms offering a range of consolidated services (e.g., payments, transport, government services).

name: Machine Customers
notes: Non-human entities (AI agents, devices, robots) that autonomously negotiate and purchase goods or services.

name: AI-Driven Cyber Defense
notes: Autonomous systems using AI/ML to detect, analyze, and automatically respond to cyber threats in real-time.

name: Quantum-Safe Networking
notes: Implementing quantum key distribution (QKD) or PQC algorithms across network infrastructure.

name: Decentralized Digital Identity (DID)
notes: User-controlled, privacy-preserving digital identifiers, often underpinned by blockchain/DLT.

name: Green IT & Sustainable Data Centers
notes: Focus on energy efficiency, optimized cooling, and renewable power for all data and computing infrastructure.

name: Circular Electronics Manufacturing
notes: Designing electronics for repair, refurbishment, and full material recovery/recycling to reduce waste.

name: AI for Climate Resilience
notes: Using AI/ML to model, predict, and automate responses to climate risks (e.g., extreme heat, floods) within urban areas.
